feed.title: ALEX BEVILACQUA
feed.subtitle: Programming, MongoDB, Ruby and anything else I find interesting. Sometimes dabble in RPG/JRPG/Adventure game reviews.

entry.title: Will Upgrading My MongoDB Server Version Break My Application?

link.title: Will Upgrading My MongoDB Server Version Break My Application?

entry.summary: Upgrading components is an important part of maintaining a healthy application. The MongoDB Server is continually being developed to include new features and functionality, as well as to fix bugs, potential vulnerabilities and attack vectors. To ensure users are using the “latest and greatest” whenever possible, MongoDB publicizes Software Lifecycle Schedules to make it clear when various compo...

feed.entry: Live Migration of Sharded Clusters to MongoDB Atlas could result in TooManyLogicalSessions Errors<link href="https://www.alexbevi.com/blog/2023/01/12/live-migration-of-sharded-clusters-can-result-in-toomanylogicalsessions/" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Live Migration of Sharded Clusters to MongoDB Atlas could result in TooManyLogicalSessions Errors" />2023-01-12T15:14:50-05:00 2023-01-13T12:29:02-05:00 https://www.alexbevi.com/blog/2023/01/12/live-migration-of-sharded-clusters-can-result-in-toomanylogicalsessions/ Alex Bevilacqua The following is more of a diagnostic journey than anything else, and does not reflect a current issue with MongoDB Atlas. While I was still working as a Technical Services Engineer at MongoDB in 2021 a small number of customers were reporting that their applications would start throwing errors similar to the following after upgrading from MongoDB 3.6 to 4.0: Command failed with error 26...

entry.title: Cruise for a Corpse (Delphine Software International) - 1991

link.title: Cruise for a Corpse (Delphine Software International) - 1991

entry.summary: This review is part of the “Let’s Adventure!” series. See all reviewed games sorted by rating here. Cruise for a Corpse is designed as a murder investigation. The player assumed the role of Raoul Dusentier, a French police inspector invited to spend some time on Niklos Karaboudjan’s boat. Quickly after arriving, Karaboudjan is murdered, and the investigation begins. The characters on the ship...

entry.title: My 2022 Reading List
entry.summary: I love to read, but I’ve found lately I have less time to actually sit down with a book. As a result I’ve been listening to a lot more audio books through Audible. Since I was able to get through multiple books this year I figured I’d throw a quick summary together to cover what I’d “read”. The 4 Disciplines of Execution By: Sean Covey, Chris McChesney, Jim Huling The 4 Disciplines of Execu...

entry.title: Nightshade (Beam Software) - 1992
entry.summary: This review is part of the “Let’s Adventure!” series. See all reviewed games sorted by rating here. Nightshade, fully titled Nightshade Part 1: The Claws of Sutekh onscreen, is an action-adventure video game released in 1992 for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It was developed by Beam Software and published by Ultra Games. The game was meant to be the first part in a series, but no sequels ...
